data.title: The Middle
data.statement:
The goal is to print the middle element from an array of strings.

If the array length is an even number, you must print the concatenation of the two centermost elements.

For example, for the array {{I, LOVE, YOU}} you should output the string {{LOVE}}.
For the array {{1, 4, potato, 6}} you should output the string {{4potato}}.

testCases.title: I hate to Love you here --> toLove
testCases.testIn: I hate to Love you here

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn: p o t a t o 1 2 3 4 5

testCases.title: Test 9 - A pretty big string

data.inputDescription: <<Line 1: >> A string [[s]] containing a series of space-separated elements, representing the array.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1: >>  the middle element of [[s]], or the concatenation of the two middle elements of [[s]].

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

The goal is to print the middle element from an array of strings.

If the array length is an even number, you must print the concatenation of the two centermost elements.

For example, for the array I, LOVE, YOU you should output the string LOVE.
For the array 1, 4, potato, 6 you should output the string 4potato.
Input
Line 1: A string s containing a series of space-separated elements, representing the array.
Output
Line 1: the middle element of s, or the concatenation of the two middle elements of s.
Constraints
1 <= length of s <= 1048
Example
Input
I hate to Love you here
Output
toLove
